description: PARIS — Mayor Anne Hidalgo on Wednesday assured Olympians that the River Seine will be safe for swimming and promised to take a dip into the waters before athletes dive in.
title: Paris mayor says Seine will be safe for Olympics and vows to swim in the river before athletes do

description: In a sudden announcement Wednesday, Kenya’s president William Ruto withdrew a controversial finance bill that sparked violent protests and a deadlly government crackdown.
title: After a month of deadly protests, Kenya's president withdraws tax bill that sparked outrage

description: Brazil's Supreme Court voted to decriminalize possession of marijuana for personal use, a move that could reduce its massive prison population.
title: Brazil’s Supreme Court decriminalizes possession of marijuana for personal use

description: Denmark will tax livestock farmers for the greenhouse gases emitted by their cows, sheep and pigs from 2030, the first country in the world to do so.
title: Gassy cows and pigs will face a carbon tax in Denmark — a world first

description: A Guatemalan appeals court on Tuesday revoked a judge’s order to give house arrest to journalist José Rubén Zamora, known for railing against corruption in the Central American country.
title: Guatemalan appeals court revokes order to grant house arrest to journalist José Rubén Zamora

description: The trial of WSJ reporter Evan Gershkovich got underway in Russia. The American journalist was arrested there 15 months ago on charges of espionage. Evan Gershkovich, the Wall Street Journal, and the U.S. government deny these accusations. NBC News' Matt Bodner reports on what to expect from Gershkovich's trial.
title: WSJ reporter Evan Gershkovich's trial underway in Russian court

description: Human rights lawyer Jennifer Robinson said Julian Assange had pleaded guilty in order to secure his release and accused the U.S. of creating "the criminalization of journalism." Stella Assange said she hoped her husband would find the space to recover "slowly ... and quickly."
title: Assange's lawyer says U.S. has criminalized journalism while his wife says he needs to recover

description: Mujahid Abadi, 24, stepped outside to see if Israeli forces had entered his uncle's neighborhood in the West Bank city of Jenin. What happened to him next made international headlines and drew widespread condemnation.
title: Palestinian man strapped to Israeli jeep hood tells of his ordeal

description: When Mujahid Abadi stepped outside to see if Israeli forces had entered his uncle’s neighborhood, he was shot in the arm and the foot.
title: Palestinian man describes being shot, beaten and tied to an Israeli army jeep. The army says he posed no threat.

description: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange arrived in his home country of Australia a free man on Wednesday, after pleading guilty to conspiracy in a U.S. court in a deal that ended his yearslong legal battle. Assange’s plane, touched down in the Australian capital of Canberra at 7:37 p.m. (5:37 a.m. ET)
title: Watch: WikiLeaks Julian Assange punches the air as he arrives in Canberra a free man

description: Fifteen months after Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich was arrested in the Russian city of Yekaterinburg on espionage charges, he returned to the city for a trial behind closed doors. NBC News' Matt Bodner reports for Early Today.
title: Trial of U.S. journalist Evan Gershkovich gets underway in Russia

description: At least five people have died after police opened fire on Kenyan protesters trying to storm a parliament building over a controversial tax bill. The bill, that was approved by lawmakers, is expected to raise taxes by $2.7 billion.
title: At least five are dead after Kenyan protesters stormed parliament

description: Luma Energy, Puerto Rico’s privately owned power company, announced they would suspend $65 million worth of maintenance projects due to “budget constraints.” This comes as the island continues to face several blackouts leaving millions without power.
title: Power company suspends $65 million in maintenance projects in Puerto Rico
